Questionnaire.QuestionnaireDescription: Assesses autistic traits across social, communication, attention, and imagination domains.
Questionnaire.QuestionnaireIntroduction:
The Autism Spectrum Quotient (AQ) is a self-report questionnaire designed to measure the extent of autistic traits in adults. It assesses social skills, attention to detail, attention switching, communication, and imagination. 

The AQ provides a standardized way to understand characteristics associated with the autism spectrum, helping individuals and clinicians identify areas of strength and challenge in daily life.
Questions: I prefer to do things with others rather than on my own.
I prefer to do things the same way over and over again.
I find it difficult to imagine what it would be like to be someone else.
I am fascinated by numbers or patterns.
I notice small changes in my environment.
I frequently get so strongly absorbed in one thing that I lose sight of other things.
I find social situations easy.
I enjoy social chit-chat.
I find it easy to work out what someone is thinking or feeling.
I like to plan things carefully.
I am fascinated by dates.
I find it difficult to work out peopleâ€™s intentions.
I tend to notice details that others do not.
I would rather go to a library than a party.
I find it hard to make new friends.
I enjoy meeting new people.
I tend to have very strong interests.
I enjoy doing things spontaneously.
I find it hard to tell if someone is interested in me.
I am good at social chit-chat.
I am fascinated by patterns in things like music, numbers, or art.
I find it difficult to understand what is meant by indirect speech.
I like to collect information about categories of things.
I find it difficult to imagine what it would be like to be in someone else's shoes.
I like to do things in a particular order.
I am often the last to understand a joke.
I like to know exactly how things will happen in advance.

I enjoy social events.

I get upset if my daily routine is disturbed.
I enjoy social gatherings.
I find it difficult to do more than one thing at once.
I am interested in other people's feelings.
I tend to focus on details rather than the bigger picture.
I prefer work that is predictable.
I enjoy meeting new people.
I often notice small sounds when others do not.
I am good at understanding how someone feels based on their tone of voice.
I tend to have narrow interests.
I enjoy social interactions.
I like to collect facts about things I am interested in.
I find it hard to judge how someone is feeling.
I am fascinated by patterns and sequences.
I prefer to plan rather than act spontaneously.
I find it easy to understand sarcasm.
I enjoy discussing abstract ideas.
I like to know the rules in advance.
I find it difficult to interpret other people's facial expressions.
I am interested in patterns in numbers or shapes.
